item.description:
Distance: 5 miles

Duration: up to 3 hours

Difficulty: Strenuous

This hike will take us around the southern end of Beach Pond and through the surrounding woodland which has many rocky outcroppings. The trail will lead us down to Deep Pond and over the Brushy Brook and by an old abandoned farm site. There will be a lot of elevation change which will require you to be well fit for this hike but its worth the effort.

As always, good footwear, extra water and a great sense of humor are a must to make this an enjoyable hike. Please read the Rhode Island Hiking Club's liability waiver and understand that this is  a condition of your participation for this hike.

Beach Pond is located on Rt. 165 on the Connecticut border. Traveling west on 165 the parking lot will be on your right at the pond.
item.how_to_find_us: meet in the lot at the pond

group.name: Rhode Island Hiking Club " Walks and Rambles "

item.name: Beach Pond South
